article.headline: LIU Brooklyn 71, Lafayette 60
article.story: NEW YORK -- Julian Boyd scored 20 points, grabbed 10 rebounds and blocked two shots to help LIU Brooklyn beat Lafayette 71-60 on Saturday. Jamal Olasewere finished with 15 points, 11 rebounds and five steals for the Blackbirds (2-4), who have won two straight. Jason Brickman had 12 points and 10 assists, and C.J. Garner added 11 points. LIU Brooklyn trailed 42-39 with 11:54 left in the second half when Lafayette's Seth Hinrichs made two free throws. But the Leopards (2-7) lost their lead and were unable to relinquish it after Brandon Thompson's 3-pointer with 9:42 left. The Blackbirds used a 10-1 run, led by Boyd's seven points, to give them a 59-49 lead with 2:35 left in the game and build enough cushion for the win. Dan Trist had 15 points with five turnovers for Lafayette, which remains winless on the road this season. Levi Giese had 14 points and Hinrichs added 10.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
